solution_line_template: For the first 20 days, the combined rate of disappearance of pollywogs from the pond is {natural_disappearance_rate}+{melvin_catch_rate}=<<{natural_disappearance_rate}+{melvin_catch_rate}={combined_rate_first_period}>>{combined_rate_first_period} pollywogs per day.

During these first {first_period_days} days, the total number of pollywogs removed was {combined_rate_first_period}*{first_period_days}=<<{combined_rate_first_period}*{first_period_days}={pollywogs_removed_first_period}>>{pollywogs_removed_first_period} pollywogs.

This means after 20 days there were {initial_pollywogs}-{pollywogs_removed_first_period}=<<{initial_pollywogs}-{pollywogs_removed_first_period}={pollywogs_left_after_first_period}>>{pollywogs_left_after_first_period} pollywogs left in the pond.

At a disappearance rate of rate {natural_disappearance_rate} pollywogs per day, it will take an additional {pollywogs_left_after_first_period}/{natural_disappearance_rate}=<<{pollywogs_left_after_first_period}/{natural_disappearance_rate}={additional_days}>>{additional_days} days for the rest of the pollywogs to disappear from the pond.
Thus, overall, it will take {first_period_days}+{additional_days}=<<{first_period_days}+{additional_days}={total_days}>>{total_days} days for all of the pollywogs to disappear from the pond.
